PAN ke Menag soal Radikalisme: Belajar Agama Lagi Pak Menteri
07 Nov 2019, 13:21 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi semasa menjadi bagian dari tim pemenangan Jokowi Bravo 5. (Foto: Detikcom Photo/Rengga Sancaya)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Anggota Komisi VIII DPR RI dari Fraksi PAN Ali Taher meminta Menteri Agama (Menag) Fachrul Razi kembali belajar tentang agama agar pemerintah tidak terlalu mencampuri pengamalan agama di masyarakat.Taher menegaskan tak sepakat dengan pernyataan-pernyataan Menteri Fachrul soal radikalisme. Menurutnya, Fachrul terlalu banyak mencampuri pengamalan agama atas nama radikalisme."Oleh karena itu, belajarlah tentang apa itu agama, Pak Menteri. Apa itu faith dan apa itu religion. Agama pasal 29 adalah organisasi, mengatur, bukan faith. Faith itu iman, jangan diganggu," kata Taher dalam Rapat Kerja Menteri Agama RI dengan Komisi VIII DPR RI di Kompleks Parlemen, Jakarta, Kamis (7/11).Taher mencontohkan religion berkaitan dengan kerukunan antarumat beragama dan hubungan antara agama dengan pemerintah. Wilayah ini boleh dimasuki dan diatur oleh negara.Sementara faith adalah wilayah agama yang berkaitan dengan kepercayaan, seperti ibadah. Taher menyebut Fachrul dan jajarannya tidak boleh sama sekali masuk ke wilayah ini.Dia meminta Fachrul untuk berhenti bicara radikalisme. Sebab radikalisme versi Fachrul selama ini dinilai menyudutkan praktik keagamaan."Yang keliru adalah menggunakan radikalisme pada konteks politik yang menghancurkan agama," tegasnya.Taher juga mengingatkan posisi Kemenag sebagai penengah antaragama di Indonesia. Jika terus-menerus memicu polemik terkait agama, maka akan jadi kontraproduktif."Anda dan Kemenag menjadi wasit. Jangan sampai wasit Anda berjalan di dalamnya. Kemudian Anda kehilangan para pemain, maka Anda jalan sendirian. Hati-hati bisa ditinggalkan umat," ucap dia.Sejak dilantik Presiden Joko Widodo pada 23 Oktober 2019, Fachrul secara konsisten menyatakan tak ada toleransi untuk radikalisme. Beberapa poin yang ia utamakan adalah penolakan paham khilafah dan pembatasan penggunaan cadar serta celana cingkrang di instansi pemerintah.Pada Lokakarya Peningkatan Peran dan Fungsi Imam Tetap Masjid di Hotel Best Western, Jakarta, Rabu (30/10), Fachrul juga mengumumkan hendak melakukan penataran penceramah. Sebab ia banyak menemukan pendakwah yang membodohi umat dan menyebarkan paham radikal."Memang kita pasti dalam waktu dekat akan segera melakukan semacam penataran penceramah, ustaz. Bagi yang mau, yang enggak mau ya enggak apa-apa, silakan, kita enggak maksa," ujar Fachrul dalam Lokakarya Peningkatan Peran dan Fungsi Imam Tetap Masjid di Hotel Best Western, Jakarta, Rabu (30/10).Terkait rencana pelarangan cadar, Fachrul membatalkan rencana tersebut. Dia juga meminta maaf apabila rencana pelarangan cadar dan celana cingkrang memicu gesekan-gesekan. Namun, Fachrul yakin itu bukan hal yang salah."Kalau itu menimbulkan beberapa gesekan-gesekan ya mohon maaf. Rasa-rasanya enggak ada yang salah rasanya. Mungkin saya mengangkatnya agak terlalu cepat," ujarnya dalam pertemuan dengan pimpinan Komisi VIII DPR RI dan Ketua Kelompok Fraksi di Hotel Sultan, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11). (dhf/wis)

PAN to Minister of Religion on Radicalism: Learn Religion Again, Minister
Nov 7 2019, 13:21 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi was part of the Jokowi Bravo 5 winning team (Photo: Detikcom Photo / Rengga Sancaya)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Member of the House of Representatives Commission VIII of the PAN faction Ali Taher asked the Minister of Religion (Menag) Fachrul Razi to return to study religion so that the government does not interfere in the practice of religion in society. Taher stressed he disagreed with Minister Fachrul's statements on radicalism . According to him, Fachrul interfered too much in the practice of religion in the name of radicalism. "Therefore, learn about what is religion, Minister. What is faith and what is religion. Religion article 29 is an organization, governing, not faith. Faith is faith, don't disturbed, "Taher said in the Working Meeting of the Minister of Religion of the Republic of Indonesia with the House of Representatives Commission VIII at the Parliament Complex, Jakarta, Thursday (7/11). This region may be entered and regulated by the state. While faith is a religious area related to beliefs, such as worship. Taher said Fachrul and his ranks were not allowed to enter this area at all. He asked Fachrul to stop talking about radicalism. Because Fachrul's version of radicalism has been judged as cornering religious practices. "What's wrong is using radicalism in a political context that destroys religion," he stressed. If you continue to trigger polemics related to religion, it will be counterproductive. "You and the Ministry of Religion become referees. Do not let your referees walk in it. Then you lose the players, then you walk alone. Be careful people can leave," he said Since being installed by President Joko Widodo on October 23, 2019, Fachrul has consistently stated that there is no tolerance for radicalism. Some of the points he prioritized were the rejection of the Khilafah understanding and restrictions on the use of veils and pants for government agencies. At the Workshop on Increasing the Role and Function of the Permanent Imam of the Mosque at the Best Western Hotel, Jakarta, Wednesday (30/10), Fachrul also announced he wanted to conduct a lecturer upgrading. . Because he found many preachers who fool people and spread radical understanding. "Indeed, we certainly will soon be doing a kind of lecturer upgrading, Ustadh. For those who want, who don't want to do nothing, go ahead, we don't force them," said Fachrul in the Workshop on Improving the Role and Function of the Permanent Imam of the Mosque at the Best Western Hotel, Jakarta, Wednesday (30/10). Regarding the veil ban plan, Fachrul canceled the plan. He also apologized if the plan to ban the veil and trousers sparked friction. However, Fachrul believes that is not the wrong thing. "If it causes some friction, yes, I'm sorry. I don't think there is anything wrong. Maybe I raised it a bit too soon," he said in a meeting with the House of Representatives Commission VIII leaders and Chair Faction Group at Sultan Hotel, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5). (dhf / wis)
